description: This is a market on whether the number of Americans that file weekly jobless claims will exceed 720,000 for the week ending on Saturday, April 10, 2021. This market will resolve to “Yes” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were more than 720,000 seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on April 10, 2021. This market will resolve to “No” if the United States Department of Labor reports that there were 720,000 or less seasonally adjusted initial claims for unemployment insurance for the week ending on April 10, 2021. The resolution source for this market will be the United States Department of Labor’s Weekly Uninsurance Claims report for the week ending on Saturday, April 10, 2021, expected to be released on Thursday, April 15, 2021, 8:30 AM ET. Resolution of this market will take place upon release of the aforementioned data.

markets.question: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 720K for the week ending on April 10?

title: Will weekly jobless claims exceed 720K for the week ending on April 10?
